content.description: Not exactly the "pride" of Prescott. This problem is close to senator hw. Slabby moves up bulge to sloping top-out. Cool little problem.
content.location: Directly off of the road across the street from the island. The route is south-facing and can easily be viewed from the  highway.

content.description: Hidden Gem. Start on good opposing holds and find a way to get up to the one obvious in-cut crimp just below lip. Slap arête and find the good hold way back there.
content.location: Behind the whole world boulder. Lone boulder in field, problem is south-facing. Look around, you will find it.

content.description: Contrived but awesome. Climb up narrow slab between two features. Avoid the large hueco on left and angling crack to the right. Delicate balance/smedging will lead you to commiting top out.
content.location: Park at island, walk towards lifestyles. Walk left at the top of the hill when you see big boulder with lone knob. It is on the large slab behind.

content.description: When hiking trail to whole world/lifestyles this is the first boulder you see. This problem climbs the distinct lone knob on the center of the face. Not really any other hand-holds. Elusive move to get on top of knob, really fun. Seems harder until you work out the beta.
content.location: First boulder you see when approaching the whole world/lifestyles.

content.description: One of the better problems in the whole world area. Stand start at side-pulls and crimpers and work up to shelf, mantle finish. Good stuff.
content.location: The dense concentration of boulders directly across Senator Hw. Problem lies on south-face of largest boulder in pile.  Farthest problem climbers right.

content.description: This problem climbs the cool alligator head prow. Best if climbed a la "Crocodile" in Fontainebleau.
content.location: In the dense cluster of boulders just near the highway, near hell-raiser. This one is visible from the road.

content.description: A one move wonder. Start at high crimps. Smear improbable feet and throw for rail.
content.location: West facing boulder at back of pile. Look for the head-high crimps.

content.description: Directly across Senator hw. from the Island. Boulders can be seen from the road.  This area offers a dense concentration of moderate boulders of excellent quality.  Harder problems exist in the area.
